revised_title: Experimental Demonstration of Light Scattering by Dust-free Air
tldr: The author conducted an experiment to study the scattering of light by dust-free air and observed a blue track along the beam, which was visible even without dust particles. The experiment proved that the scattering was not due to dust but a property of pure air, and its intensity was of the expected order of magnitude. The author also ruled out the possibility of fluorescence by performing a spectroscopic examination of the scattered light.
